name: terra-icon
description: The terra-icon component is used to visually represent a literal or symbolic object intended to initiate an action, communicate a status, or navigate the workflow.
author: Cerner Corporation

scripts.compilescripts: npm run compilescripts:clean && npm run compilescripts:build
scripts.migrate-ocs-icons: npm run compilescripts && npm run migrate-csv && npm run migrate-svg && npm run generate-json && npm run generate-icons && npm run generate-example
scripts.generate-all-icons: npm run generate-meaningful-icons && npm run generate-decorative-icons
scripts.generate-decorative-icons: npm run create-decorative-dir && npm run replace-decorative-baseclass && npm run replace-decorative-import && npm run replace-decorative-displayname
scripts.migrate-cerner-one-icons: npm run compilescripts && npm run migrate-csv && npm run migrate-svg && npm run generate-json && npm run generate-all-icons && npm run generate-example
scripts.lint: npm run lint:js && npm run lint:scss
scripts.test: npm run lint && npm run jest && npm run wdio
scripts.wdio: npm run wdio-default && npm run wdio-lowlight && npm run wdio-fusion
